sentence: Technology stocks were edging higher in Thursday morning trading, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 as measured by the Technology Select Sector SPDR ETF posting a 0.19% gain%.

In company news, NetEase ( NTES ) was slumping in Thursday's pre-market after Q4 gross margin at the Chinese Internet software firm disappointed investors and upstaged better-than-expected net income and sales for the final three months of 2015.
Gross margin for the quarter slipped to 53% during the October-to-December period, down from 58% and 78% during the prior quarter and the year-ago period, respectively.

Excluding one-time items, it earned RMB 16.34, or $2.52, per American depository share, up from RMB 9.67 per ADS during the same quarter last year and beating the Capital IQ consensus expecting RMB 14.79 per ADS.
Revenue increased 128.2% year-over-year to RMB 7.9 billion, or $1.22 billion, beating the Street view expecting RMB 7.69 billion in Q4 sales.
NTES ADS were down almost 9% at $145.25 apiece in Thursday pre-market trading after sliding as low as $150 a share during the late session last night.

In other sector news, Salesforce.com ( CRM ) shares were rising this morning after the customer relationship management software company reported a 25.3% increase in Q4 revenue over year-ago levels, reaching $1.81 billion and narrowly beating the $1.79 billion consensus.
The company earned $0.19 per share during the October-to-December period, matching estimates.
It sees net income for the current quarter in a range of $0.23 to $0.24, topping the Street view by at least $0.02 per share.
Its projected Q1 revenue of $1.885 billion to $1.895 billion exceeds expectations by at least $25 million.
CRM shares were up more than 10% at $69.00 a share this morning at $62.52 apiece, extending a 9% advance during Wednesday's after-hours.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
